definition: dream/CL:場|场[chang2],個|个[ge4]/(bound form) to dream

sentences.english: Even the sleepy Endymion was fascinated at the sight of the fair maiden as he opened his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 但眼前的一切很快消失，以致他誤認爲這是一場夢幻。

sentences.english: His essay offers an analysis of the film that focuses on the dreamlike nature of the world of the Matrix.
sentences.chinese: 他的文章主要分析電影中的夢幻般矩陣世界。

sentences.english: She was a devoted admirer of "The Dream Journey.
sentences.chinese: 她是《夢幻之旅》忠實的崇拜者。

sentences.english: The flying waving in the wind, turn the illusive Buddhism country into the vigorous world.
sentences.chinese: 飄舞的飛天，將夢幻佛國變成生機的世界。
這幅夢幻般的照片下面掩蓋着悲劇。

sentences.english: That was until Sinclair cracked it home with a fantastic diagonal shot.
sentences.chinese: 直到辛克萊禁區斜角的夢幻施射才破門。

sentences.english: Being a dreamer but not living in a dream world.
sentences.chinese: 做個理想家，但不能活在夢幻的世界裏。

sentences.english: You are a dweller in my deathless dreams.
sentences.chinese: 你是我永生夢幻中的居住者。

sentences.english: Circumambulate the city of a dreamy sabbath afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 在一個夢幻的下午休息時間的城市巡行。

sentences.english: Not only beautiful image, also traction sculpture of love people dream of aestheticism.
sentences.chinese: 不但雕塑美的形象，還牽引人們對戀愛唯美的夢幻。

sentences.english: With her cloud-pale eyelids falling on dream-dimmed eyes;
sentences.chinese: 蒼雲般的眼瞼遮住夢幻般的眼睛。

sentences.english: You are the evening cloud floating in the sky of my dreams.
sentences.chinese: 你是一朵夜雲，在我夢幻中的天空中浮泛。

sentences.english: No dreamscape could be woven of slenderer thread.
sentences.chinese: 再細的線條也編織不出夢幻的景象。

sentences.english: But when youth , the dream , departs .
sentences.chinese: 可是，夢幻般的青春一旦消逝。

sentences.english: His brain was clouded by vapours and dreams.
sentences.chinese: 他的腦子裏充滿空想和夢幻。
這造成了一種宛如真實的夢幻。

definition: mien/bearing/grace/amorous feelings/flirtatious expressions/local conditions and customs/wind force, direction etc
